column4: Hi, will someone answer this question please ? Does the kernel support image blitting in console ?
tile blitting?
if thats what you mean then yes i think it does
yes, using hte frame buffer
for example, you can watch a movie full screen without x on the fb
using mplayer
http://gentoo-wiki.com/HOWTO_MPlayer_on_Framebuffer
not that i am aware of
it may be though..
i have never seen it
there is a small x implementation for embedded devices you could use at a push i suppose
ok, thanks anyway. apt-cache show w3m-img gave me a hint that w3m-img supports inline images in X terminal and 'Linux frame buffer'' ? I wonder what does 'frame buffer' mean ?
its direct access to the graphics cards frame buffer.. if your card is supported (probably is) then that should work'
thats a good start :)'
test it with mplayer -vo fb file.avi
thank you, I'll try that. I'l come back with w3m later.
gl
thank you, this is perfect :) I've got w3m working
excellent
this link might help you: http://lists.freebsd.org/pipermail/freebsd-questions/2004-October/060534.html
Thanks.
the problem is that he has an unssuported hardware which the 2.6.18 kernel has an experimental patch for
The version of links2 in the Ubuntu tree doesn't support TSL by default, AFAIK.
